I'm not sure I love this. Perhaps we create a common interface called ContentLocale and have AssemblyLocale and ModuleLocale extend from it and change the JCR primary type.
Is there a reason why we would need separate node types for this? We could have a single pant:contentLocale.

I was discussing with Lisa the trade-offs of trying to remove some of the code duplication that will eventually come out of this (we happen to have two very similar content structures) and in the end what we realized is that it's probably better to endure the duplication now and revisit the need for it down the line.
Yeah, I would agree with that. Let's keep things separate until the code solidifies and then we can re-evaluate based on where things actually wound up.
I created a DocumentLocale(Child of Document). I kept ModuleLocale and AssemblyLocale around.
I would call the operation pant:newAssemblyVersion so that it aligns with the module-centric endpoint
i was trying to make a generic operation that would handle both module and assembly upload. we just ask uploader to pass in a contentType, we can get away with using one upload servlet  .

I see. Thing is if we are going to duplicate the classes, we might as well duplicate this one also, otherwise it will just lead to a big if-else with the two different paths (which I guess is another route we could take).

I would rather see separate servlets. My gut tells me that as the code evolves, the servlets will look sufficiently different to warrant it. I might be wrong, but we could revisit the decision once the code matures a bit.
my initial intuition as well
renamed.
We need to extract this into a common class as it's used in more than one place now

Not sure what was your scope of "this" in your comment, but I would include extracting the bits like getting the parameters, figuring out the encoding, the commit() line, maybe even storing the source on the draft node if we can find a generic way to do that.
I meant the generation of a unique hash from any string. There is a n exact copy of this method in the ModuleVersionUpload class
I moved it to JcrResources
Why does Assembly extend Module? Are we sure that it should? Perhaps it would make more sense for both Assembly and Module to extend a common parent.
And for that matter, maybe Resource should extend from the parent as well, depending on what turns out to be shared.
who is this common parent :-)?

Well, we'd have to create one. :)
Maybe create a Document class?
Or a Content class instead? Certainly open to suggestions here.
Content class is taken. https://github.com/redhataccess/pantheon/blob/master/pantheon-bundle/src/main/java/com/redhat/pantheon/model/module/Content.java
Then Document seems like a fitting choice, unless anyone else has a 3rd option!
I implemented a generic Document class as a parent for Module and Assembly. I also add a DocumentLocale, which is a Child of Document. Let me know what guys think...
Pointing out here that if you change the servlet operation to 'pant:newAssemblyVersion' as Carlos suggested, you'd need to change it here, too.
